author: Hutton, Laurence
snippet: Here Scott, among other things, was diligently at work upon his " Napoleon." In November, 1826, he took a furnished house — more comfortable in every way — at No. 3 Walker Street, on the east side, near Coates Crescent. From this house, on the evening of the 23d of February, 1827, he walked to the Assembly Rooms in George Street, near Hanover Street, and there, at a public dinner, he confessed for the first time in public the author ship of the " Waverley Novels."
